contentList.content: When the Great Sundering of Elves happened, The Eilistraean were forced to go with their Drow brethren, but went willingly. Ever hopeful one day they would be able to unite all Elves again. Despite their treatment they neither fully embracing the light or entirely shunning the dark, these Elves live somewhere inbetween trying to reconcile the rift between their cousins.
You were born and raised on the surface in a Eilistraean community or on the fringes of an Elvish community. Never fully trusted or included due to your parental heritage.

You were born and raised in the underdark in a Eilistraean community or on the fringes of an Drow community or possibly even born into a Lolth-Sworn community. Years of watching a different way of living was possible, you came to be part of the Eilistraeans.
Summon Moonfire, a small mote of light that can manipulate and interact with objects.
You enjoy a good adventure. Always ready to set foot out the door and investigate what that day will bring and where it will take you.
You are a loyal protector of your Kith and Kin. You will go to great lengths to see they are unharmed, even if they are the ones trying to harm you.
You love a good puzzle. Constantly looking for and into the various machinations the world has to offer to see how they work.

You enjoy a good adventure. Always ready to set foot out the door and investigate what that day will bring and where it will take you. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Investigation">Investigation</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Survival">Survival</LSTag>.

You are a loyal protector of your Kith and Kin. You will go to great lengths to see they are unharmed, even if they are the ones trying to harm you. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="History">History</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Religion">Religion</LSTag>.

You love a good puzzle. Constantly looking for and into the various machinations the world has to offer to see how they work. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Insight">Insight</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Arcana">Arcana</LSTag>.
Your time spent in the underdark and dealing with their machinations has made you reistant to poison.
Having to spend a good amount of time hiding who you are and who you are working with has made you a natural at blending in with the scenery.
Life in the underdark was rough and you've learned to hide truths from everyone at an early age.
You've hand to stand up for what you believe time and time again. You have gained a strong will due to never backing down.
Eilistraean ritual to change a beings race and/or gender so they may experience life through their own eyes.

Ignite your hand with sacred moonfire, a cold silvery flame gifted by Eilistraee. While active, your hand glows with divine frost, enabling <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Moonfire_Hurl">Throw Moonfire</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Moonfire_Touch">Touch of Moonfire</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Moonfire_Dismiss">Extinguish Moonfire</LSTag>.
Hurl the moonfire from your hand in a flash of freezing light. On hit, the target takes [1] and [2] and is afflicted with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Moonfire_Technical">Dark Maiden's Mark</LSTag>.

Strike with your glowing hand, expelling the moonfire directly into a creature. On hit, it takes [1] and [2] and is afflicted with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Moonfire_Technical">Dark Maiden's Mark</LSTag>.
Extinguish the moonfire currently burning on your hand. Ends the Moonfire state without triggering any effects. Can be used freely to deactivate Eilistraee's Moonfire.
Creature becomes seared by Eilistraee's Moonfire for 3 turns and cannot become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>.

Specialized clerics of the Dark Maiden were known as Sword Dancers. They were excellent dancers and spellsingers, known to use an agile and acrobatic fencing style resembling a dance. The sword dancers led missions to find, assist, and protect any drow looking to return to the surface (or that could be made to return) and embrace a different life. They were skilled diplomats, especially active near the settlements of elves and other races, working to establish peace and cooperation between drow and surface dwellers.

The Silverhair Knights were an order of clerics of Eilistraee completely dedicated to the redemption and subsequent protection of drow followers of Lolth, Vhaeraun, and other deities of the Dark Seldarine. They fully embraced the teaching of Eilistraee about showing mercy and compassion, and fought these dark elves only using non-lethal means, hoping to make them understand the error of their ways and choose a different life. Like the Sword Dancers, they often embarked on missions within Lolthite settlements, aiming to find and rescue drow who were in danger or seeking an alternative.

The Darksong Knights were an elite order of Eilistraeeans, mostly active in the South, beneath the lands of ancient Ilythiir. Each member of this order was a battle-priest who chose to devote their life not only to furthering the Dark Maiden's goals, but also to the destruction of yochlol and other demons and minions of Lolth, for they were the cause of the corruption and fall of the drow people.

The Protectors of the Song were the temple guards of the Promenade of the Dark Maiden, the main center of worship of Eilistraee on Faer√ªn. Their main duty was to protect the temple and patrol the area around the Pit of Ghaunadaur, to prevent the return of the slime god.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.

Summon a great sword of force that hovers within range. When the sword appears, The sword can make melee regular melee attacks and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SpellSong_MordenkainensSlash">Spell Song Mordenkainens Slash</LSTag> dealing [1]. Until the spell ends, the sword can move up to 30m from you and attack as if it was a Greatsword.
Make a melee spell attack against a target dealing [1].
Attack the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].
Cover more distance this turn: double your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag>.

This reaction won't trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Booming Blade.
Parry the next melee attack that hits you to reduce the damage by [1] + <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Ritually bind the weapon in your main hand. The weapon can't be knocked out of your hand, and it automatically returns to you when <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_Throw">Thrown</LSTag>.

Ritually bound to its wielder.

The weapon can't be knocked out of the wielder's hand, and automatically returns to the wielder when Thrown.

Charges that can be accumulated for the Eilistraean Song Climax while Eilistraean Singing. Attacking with a weapon grants a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_CHARGE">Eilistraean Song Charge</LSTag>. In addition to gaining Eilistraean Song Slot Slots.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

Attackers have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this creature, unless they do not rely on sight or can see through illusions.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

This reaction will trigger on a Critical Hit.

.
Attack an enemy moving out of your reach.

Eilistraean Song impeded by a weapon. Until the ranged weapon is removed and/or one of the required melee weapons equipped, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.

Eilistraean Song impeded by armour. Until the armour is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Whenever you successfully evade an attack, one of the duplicates disappears. Doesn't affect creatures that don't rely on sight or that can see through illusions.

Unleash the full damaging and healing effects of your Eilistraean Song at once. Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_CHARGE">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> will harm enemies an additional [1], and will heal you and your allies an additional [2].

If it is higher level than [1], you must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">check</LSTag> to prevent it. The check's difficulty is equal to [2] plus the level of the spell you are trying to counter.

<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISTRACTED">Distract</LSTag> your target, giving your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against the target.
Training in Eilistraean War and Song
Deal a bonus [1] to the target. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread green flames to burn another for [2].

Invoke the Eilistraean Blade Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> increases by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean Moon Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedAttack">Unarmed Attack</LSTag> increases by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean War Rhythm. You gain a +[1] bonus to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MainHandAttack">MainHand Attack</LSTag>. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Athletics and a +[2] bonus to Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. You are immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYSED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean Spell Song. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Performance and a +[1] bonus to Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. You also gain a +[1] bonus to Wisdom and Charisma. You are immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYSED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can retaliate with a powerful strike that deals an additional [1] damage if you are wielding a melee weapon.
You learn Eilistraean Actions <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanHide">Eilistraean Hide</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanDash">Eilistraean Dash</LSTag>.
This will end your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag>.

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and possibly knocks the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and possibly force them to drop the weapons they are holding. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISTRACTED">Distract</LSTag> your target, giving your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against it. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to [1] enemies at once dealing a bonus [2]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [3].

Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].
When hit with a melee attack, the affected entity can use a reaction and reduce the damage by [1].
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> The target can't be Huge in size.
You can use both your action and bonus action on a turn to attack a target with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and deal an additional [1] damage.
The target must be Large or smaller.
When you take the Dash Action, your Speed increases by [1] for that action.

Attacks with weapons you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in and throwing attacks scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher. Excludes Heavy and Two-handed Weapons.
Throwing attacks scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher.
Throw melee main hand to do [1] to target.
Throw melee off hand to do [1] to target.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, or Shortsword. You can not have any ranged weapon equipped.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Light or Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be Unarmed.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Light or Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, Shortsword or Greatsword.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear light, cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, or Shortsword.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear light, cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
Equipped gear, melee weapon, ranged weapon, or shield is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipped melee weapon is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipping a ranged weapon is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipped armour is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.

Nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be Level [1] or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> to nullify it, the difficulty of which is based on the spell's Level.
Can only use Moon Fire Blade once per action.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

Strike the target dealing a bonus [1] and deal extra damage to a foe you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Invoking the Eilistraean Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by [2]m. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
You can make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly knocks the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Your hands have become infused with the weave and anticipate your movements. You gain an additional action.

Eilistraean Song impeded by a shield. Until the shield is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to [1] enemies at once.
Make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly forces the target to drop the weapons they are holding.
Heal a creature you can see.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> No effect on undead and constructs.
If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> from your target.
This effect still works if your attack misses.
You gain the ability to channel certain spells through song.
Can burn a nearby enemy with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MoonFireBladeExtra">Spread Moon Fire Blade</LSTag>. Removed if you move.
You gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; You can now also perform sneak attacks if there are no other enemies within [1] of the target (the enemy is isolated).
Reactions, such as <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>, are responses you can have to events. Reactions can trigger both during and outside of your turn.

Your confidence propels you into battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>
Summon blades to sweep at creatures within [1] of you.
Hide from enemies by succeeding <LSTag Tooltip="Stealth">Stealth checks</LSTag>. Stick to the dark and avoid enemy sightlines. Attacking or casting a spell will reveal your location.
Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, A Cloud of Darkness is formed around you and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, A Cloud of Darkness is formed around you and all enemies take psychic damage. You also have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

A charge that will increase how much damage you deal to enemies by [1] and how much you heal yourself and your allies by [1] when using Eilistraean Song Climax.

You can accumulate these charges by attacking with weapons.
Use this resource to cast Spell Songs during combat

Create [1] illusory duplicates of yourself that distract attackers. Each duplicate increases your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> to [2]. Attackers have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against you.
You can't use this attack if you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with Light Armour and in the Performance skill. You also gain Proficiency with Daggers, Sickles, Shortswords, Rapiers, Scimitars, and Longswords.
The mirror image distracts attackers, increasing the spellcaster's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 3. When the caster successfully evades an attack, one of the images disappears.

Insult a creature: it has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on its next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>. Targets allies within [1] new to make a save or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> with laughter, without the ability to get up.
All the time spent practicing with blades, spells and sleight of hand has paid off. You gain an additional bonus and reaction action.
Cannot be targeted by <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MoonFireBladeExtra">Spread Moon Fire Blade</LSTag>.
During Eilistraean Song, Cleave your weapon in a rapid, sweeping arc to attack multiple enemies at once.

Eilistraean Song impeded due to being unarmed. Until a valid weapon is equipped, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and within [1] of the target. However you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Can only cast Blade Extra Attack once per action.
You conjure [2] shards of concentrated moonlight and send them streaking toward targets within range. Each shard always hits and deals [1].
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains [1] + [3]. For the duration of the spell, the target regains [2] at the start of each of its turns.

You channel the fury of Eilistraee on Fiends, weakening their very essence. Magic that would normally bounce off its form now burns its flesh. All Darksong spells and attacks will ignore any <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> the target has to all damage types.

You channel the fury of Eilistraee on Oozes, weakening their very essence. Magic that would normally bounce off its form now burns its flesh. All Darksong spells and attacks will ignore any <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> the target has to all damage types.
Wrap yourself in silvery moonlight and vanish, reappearing in an unoccupied space within 18m.
Remove Curses and Hexes on up to [1] Creatures or Objects afflicted by them within 6m.
Creature is engulfed by Eilistraee's Moonlight that deal [1] and [2] per turn. On a successful save, the creature still takes half damage.

Perform an inspiring melody that affects up to [1] of creatures within 10m who can hear you. Affected allies gain advantage on saving throws against being Charmed or Frightened, a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> equal to your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, and a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. Lasts for 10 turns while you maintain concentration.

You conjure strands of moonlight in the form of elven spirits that embrace and heal your allies. Choose up to 6 creatures within 10m who can hear you, each target is healed for [1] plus your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. The healing increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 4th.
Move Eilistraee's Moonlight up to [1]. The Moonlight damages any creature [2] and [3] that enters it or starts its turn inside.
Protect up to [1] targets, they cannot be targeted until attacking or harming another creature but can still take damage from area spells.
Fire a bolt of concentrated moonlight at a target, dealing [1] and [2] and leaving a frozen surface at the point of impact.
Protect up to [1] creatures from death. The next time damage would reduce them to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, they remain conscious with 1 hit point left.
Eilistraee's Moonlight engulfs any creature that enters this silvery light or starts its turn inside it. They take [1] and [2]. On a successful save, targets still take half damage.
Strike your foe with Eilistraee's divine power, channeling both the radiant brilliance and frigid grace of the moon dealing [1] and [2]. The [3] increases by [4] when attacking Fiends or Undead.

You perform a haunting melody that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED ">Charms</LSTag> nearby foes and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INCAPACITATED ">Incapacitates</LSTag> all creatures within 10m who fail a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, including those who enter the area later. Affected targets cannot be charmed again by this spell more than once, you cannot take actions while performing and moving will break concentration.

Empower yourself with the grace of the Dark Maiden, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next weapon attack, it deals an additional [1] and [2] on a hit and you do not provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 9m until the end of that turn.
Cure up to [1] creatures from disease, poison, paralysis or blindness within 9m.

You become so attuned to Eilistraee's own dance and song, that all your movements are cloaked in unearthly grace. You ignore effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>, have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> and if a spell or effect would deal half damage on a successful Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, it deals no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

You teleport between up to 5 enemies within range, dancing through them in a flurry of strikes. Each hit channels Eilistraee's will, dealing [1] and [2] and you reappear beside the final target, your form trailing glimmers of moonlight.

Six multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each creature in a 18m cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d6 to determine the effect.

On roll of 1: [1], on 2: [2], on 3: [3], on 4: [4], on 5: [5] and half as much on a failed save. On a 6 and a failed save, the target is Blinded. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is Banished for 4 turns.

Conjure a 4m radius circle of silvery moonlight that lasts for 3 turns. Allies inside restore [1] each turn, gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic and Psychic damage. The Daarra, more commonly known as spellbones, are a trademark magic item crafted in the Eilistraean city of Imberlur. Daarra are 5-6 inches long batons of grey-white porcelain and imbued with the power of a single spell. Breaking a spellbone releases the imbued spell under the control of the breaker, regardless to their skill in, or aptitude for, magic.

I am Vel'suss Iltaress Xal Zhal, a low-born of no house, born of no one.
When I was young, a man took me away to work for him. Always hiding, always sneaking and always killing.
I was finally ready to leave that entire life behind and make my way back to the surface when the Illithid came.
I want to walk on the Surface and find my place among them.
